question:
Currently, India is an Associate member of:
  1. International Energy Agency (IEA)
  2. European Organisation for Nuclear Research (CERN)
  3. Organisation for European Economic Co-operation (OECD)
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: India recently became an associate member of International Energy Agency (IEA). This would help India in ensuring its vision of 24 * 7 affordable and environment friendly "Power for All". The CERN convention was signed in 1953 by the 12 founding state. Currently, CERN has 22 member states. India recently became an Associate member of CERN. India is not an Associate member of Organisation for European Economic Co-operation (OECD).
